definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: We sailed out of the harbour toward the Pacific.
Please tell me the fore- and -after waterline on arrival and departure.
sentences.chinese: 請把靠港和離港的前後喫水數告訴我。

sentences.english: Let's do our best to find a solution to the problem before our ship leaves.
sentences.chinese: 咱們一起盡力在我船離港前找到一個解決問題的辦法。

sentences.english: Next training session after leaving port.
sentences.chinese: 下一次培訓會在離港後。

sentences.english: The ship cleared for Shanghai this morning.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船今天早晨結關後離港駛向上海。

sentences.english: On June 6, the ship completed the departure formalities and from the port of Cape Town.
sentences.chinese: 6月6日，該船辦妥相關離港手續並駛離開普敦港。

sentences.english: I wonder if you could supply us with some food before the ship leaves.
sentences.chinese: 不知道你們是否能在船離港前供應我們一些食物？

sentences.english: The ship departed on the high water.
Separate enough oil for the service tank before departure.
sentences.chinese: 離港前把日用油櫃分滿。

sentences.english: Tally and assemble for dispatch cargo for the Carrier's flights.
sentences.chinese: 統計並將承運人離港貨物集中待運。

sentences.english: Instruct crew on occupational safety before departure.
sentences.chinese: 在離港前指導船員職務安全。

sentences.english: Departing cargo should be verified against purchase or delivery orders.
sentences.chinese: 離港貨物應覈實對購買或交付訂單。

definition: as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
to pass through a country's territory/transit
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
